      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable(Project project)
        Description copied from interface: StatusBarWidgetFactory
        Returns availability of widget.

        `False` means that IDE won't try to create a widget or will dispose it on StatusBarWidgetsManager.updateWidget(java.lang.Class<? extends com.intellij.openapi.wm.StatusBarWidgetFactory>) call.

        E.g. `false` can be returned for

        • notifications widget if Event log is shown as a tool window
        • memory indicator widget if it is disabled in the appearance settings
        • git widget if there are no git repos in a project

        Whenever availability is changed, you need to call StatusBarWidgetsManager.updateWidget(StatusBarWidgetFactory) explicitly to get status bar updated.

        Specified by:
        isAvailable in interface StatusBarWidgetFactory

      • createWidget

        public StatusBarWidget createWidget(Project project)
        Description copied from interface: StatusBarWidgetFactory
        Creates a widget to be added to the status bar.

        Once the method is invoked on project initialization, the widget won't be recreated or disposed implicitly.

        You may need to recreate it if:

      • its availability has changed. See StatusBarWidgetFactory.isAvailable(Project)
      • its visibility has changed. See com.intellij.openapi.wm.impl.status.widget.StatusBarWidgetSettings

        • To do this, you need to explicitly invoke StatusBarWidgetsManager.updateWidget(StatusBarWidgetFactory) to recreate the widget and re-add it to the status bar.

Specified by:
createWidget in interface StatusBarWidgetFactory

  • disposeWidget

    public void disposeWidget(StatusBarWidget widget)

  • isConfigurable

    public boolean isConfigurable()
    Specified by:
    isConfigurable in interface StatusBarWidgetFactory
    Returns:
    Returns whether the user should be able to enable or disable the widget.

    Some widgets are controlled by application-level settings (e.g., Memory indicator) or cannot be disabled (e.g., Write thread indicator) and thus shouldn't be configurable via status bar context menu or settings.

  • canBeEnabledOn

    public boolean canBeEnabledOn(StatusBar statusBar)
    Specified by:
    canBeEnabledOn in interface StatusBarWidgetFactory
    Returns:
    Returns whether the widget can be enabled on the given status bar right now. Status bar's context menu with enable/disable action depends on the result of this method.

    It's better to have this method aligned with EditorBasedStatusBarPopup.WidgetState.HIDDEN, whenever state is HIDDEN, this method should return false. Otherwise enabling widget via context menu won't take any visual effect.

    E.g. EditorBasedWidget are available if editor is opened in a frame that given status bar is attached to

    For creating editor based widgets see also StatusBarEditorBasedWidgetFactory

  • isEnabledByDefault

    public boolean isEnabledByDefault()
    Specified by:
    isEnabledByDefault in interface StatusBarWidgetFactory
    Returns:
    true if the widget should be created by default. Otherwise, the user must enable it explicitly via status bar context menu or settings.
